intro: Mephitidia pterosperma, commonly known as the broad-leaved mephit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in humid climates.
